intro: Adenophora triphylla f. violacea, commonly known as violetleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with violet, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically blue to violet in color, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and stream banks.
